citation.article-title: Desulfurella kamchatkensis sp. nov. and Desulfurella propionica sp. nov., new sulfur-respiring thermophilic bacteria from Kamchatka thermal environments.

p.s: Emended description of the genus Desulfurella emend.

Cells are short rods, non-motile, or motile with one polar flagellum. Gram-negative, with outer S-layer. Domain Bacteria. Obligate anaerobe. Moderate thermophile with a temperature range between 45 and 75-80 °C, and an optimum of 55-60 °C. Neutrophile with pH optimum of 6.8-7.0. Energy conservation by sulfur or thiosulfate respiration or by pyruvate fermentation. Substrates utilized: molecular hydrogen, organic acids, fatty acids. Products: CO2, H2S. No cytochromes detected. Menaquinones present. Habitats: warm sediments, thermophilic cyanobacterial or bacterial communities, rich in organic compounds and elemental sulfur, with temperature 50-70 °C. Type species: Desulfurella acetivorans A-63T (= DSM 5264T).
